name: University Hall
description: Browns oldest building (1770); served as a barracks and hospital during the Revolution.

name: Benefit Street Mile of History
description: A cobblestone stretch with one of the highest concentrations of Colonial architecture in the US.

name: The Providence Athenaeum
description: A 200 year old independent library where Edgar Allan Poe famously spent time.

name: Prospect Terrace Park
description: Offers the iconic panoramic view of the Providence skyline and the statue of Roger Williams.

name: First Baptist Meetinghouse
description: The oldest Baptist church congregation in America (1775) with stunning Georgian architecture.

name: RISD Museum
description: World class art museum spanning ancient to contemporary works; free on Sundays.

name: Still Here
description: Large scale mural depicting a Narragansett woman located near the Providence River.

name: Providence Riverwalk
description: A paved path along the river home to the WaterFire basins and pedestrian bridges.

name: Stephen Hopkins House
description: Home of a Declaration of Independence signer built in 1707.

name: John Brown House Museum
description: 18th century mansion once described as the most elegant and magnificent in the country.

name: She Never Came
description: Massive photorealistic mural on Washington Street depicting a melancholic man at a table.

name: Misty Blue
description: Vibrant blue toned mural on Orange Street celebrating Cambodian heritage.

name: The Walk
description: The landscaped pedestrian spine connecting Browns main campus to the Jewelry District.

name: Providence Industrial
description: A red and black tribute to the citys industrial roots.

name: Old State House
description: The site where Rhode Island declared independence from Britain two months before the rest of the colonies.

name: India Point Park
description: Waterfront park at the confluence of the Seekonk and Providence Rivers great for sunsets.
